jsongminer
Class LastFMMiner

java.lang.Object
  jsongminer.LastFMMiner

public class LastFMMiner
extends java.lang.Object

Objects of this class are used to extract information from the Last.FM API with respect to a given song. Upon instantiation, an object of this class is given identifying information about a song, and a Last.FM Track object is downloaded and stored from the Last.FM API. Further method calls to an object of this LastFMMiner class can be used to extract and access further information related to the song associated with this Track object. Each LastFMMiner object is associated with one and only one song.

Metadata is extracted from the Last.FM API, which is described at http://www.last.fm/api. The queries are formatted and the results interpereted using the last.fm-bindings library, which is available at http://www.u-mass.de/lastfm.

Constructor Detail

LastFMMiner

public LastFMMiner(java.lang.String song_title,
                   java.lang.String artist_name,
                   java.lang.String api_key)
            throws java.lang.Exception
Initialize this object by setting up its fields. This includes accessing a Last.FM Track object from the Last.FM API based on the provided song title and artist name metadata.

Parameters:
song_title - The title of the song. May not be null.
artist_name - The "artist" of the song (typically refers to performer/band, although it is sometimes used to refer to composer, especially for classical music). This may be null if this information is unknown.
api_key - The Last.FM API key.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - An informative exception is thrown if invalid parameters are provided or if a match could not be found for the specified song title and artist.
Method Detail

getSongMetaData

public MusicMetaData[] getSongMetaData(boolean store_fails)
Extract all available metadata on Last.FM for the Track stored in this object. This excludes metadata about the artist, however, which can be obtained using the getArtistMetaData method.

Parameters:
store_fails - If this is true, then for each individual piece of metadata that cannot be extracted from the Last.FM API an indication is added to the returned MusicMetaData array highlighting the failure. If this is false then fields that cannot be extracted are simply ignored.
Returns:
An array holding references to all of the extracted track metadata. Null is returned if no data could be found.

getArtistMetaData

public MusicMetaData[] getArtistMetaData(boolean store_fails)
Extract all available on Last.FM metadata for the artist associated with the Track stored in this object.

Parameters:
store_fails - If this is true, then for each individual piece of metadata that cannot be extracted from the Last.FM API an indication is added to the returned MusicMetaData array highlighting the failure. If this is false then fields that cannot be extracted are simply ignored.
Returns:
An array holding references to all of the extracted artist metadata. Null is returned if no data could be found.

getAlbumMetaData

public MusicMetaData[] getAlbumMetaData(boolean store_fails)
Extract all available on Last.FM metadata for the album associated with the Track stored in this object.

Parameters:
store_fails - If this is true, then for each individual piece of metadata that cannot be extracted from the Last.FM API an indication is added to the returned MusicMetaData array highlighting the failure. If this is false then fields that cannot be extracted are simply ignored.
Returns:
An array holding references to all of the extracted album metadata. Null is returned if no data could be found.

getAllAvailableNewMetaData

public boolean getAllAvailableNewMetaData(java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> song_metadata,
                                          java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> artist_metadata,
                                          java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> album_metadata,
                                          java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData>> artists_already_extracted,
                                          java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData>> albums_already_extracted,
                                          boolean store_fails)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
Extracts all available song and, if appropriate, artist and album metadata from the Last.FM API for the Track stored in this object. Adds the extracted metadata to the Vector parameters of this method.

Song metadata is always extracted. Artist and album metadata are only extracted if they have not already been extracted for the given artist or album (respectively) during the processing of another song, as indicated by the presence of the artist's name (in lower case) in the artists_already_extracted parameter, or the album's title (in lower case) in the albums_already_extracted parameter, respectively. Note that this method does not update either of these hash maps in any way, as it is left to the calling object to do this.

Parameters:
song_metadata - A Vector of metadata already extracted for this song. May not be null, but may be empty.
artist_metadata - A Vector of metadata already extracted for the artist associated with this song. May not be null, but may be empty.
album_metadata - A Vector of metadata already extracted for the album associated with this song. May not be null, but may be empty.
artists_already_extracted - A hash map whose keys correspond to artist names (converted to lower case), and whose values correspond to vectors of corresponding artist metadata. The contents are based on the processing of previous songs. This parameter may be null, in which case it is ignored and artist extraction happens automatically. Also, the values may be null, in order to save space and processing for the calling object, but this has no effect on this method, as only the keys are used.
albums_already_extracted - A hash map whose keys correspond to album titles (converted to lower case), and whose values correspond to vectors of corresponding album metadata. The contents are based on the processing of previous songs. This parameter may be null, in which case it is ignored and album extraction happens automatically. Also, the values may be null, in order to save space and processing for the calling object, but this has no effect on this method, as only the keys are used.
store_fails - If this is true, then for each individual piece of metadata that cannot be extracted from the Last.FM API an indication is added to the stored MusicMetaData highlighting the failure. If this is false then fields that cannot be extracted are simply ignored. Note that this parameter has no effect on song identification specifically.
Returns:
True is returned if a change was made to song_metadata, artist_metadata or both.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - An exception is thrown if invalid parameters are passed.

getLastFMTrackURL

public java.lang.String getLastFMTrackURL()
Return the Last.FM Track URL for the song referred to by this object.

Returns:
The Last.FM Track URL for this song. Null is returned if this information could not be provided.

getIdentifyingMetadataForSong

public java.lang.String[] getIdentifyingMetadataForSong()
Return the song title, artist name and album title for the song referred to by this object.

Returns:
The song title, artist name and album title (in that order). Null is returned if this information could not be provided.

getAlbumNameLowerCase

public java.lang.String getAlbumNameLowerCase()
Get the album name for the album associated with the song held in this object

Returns:
The name of the album, or null if it could not be found or a problem occured. Note that the album's name is converted to lower case in the returned string.
